result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ngin Tual Pum

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Defendant Ngin Tual Pum in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Ngin Tual Pum.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko (Burmese Interpreter).
Matter scheduled for DPA Hearing.  Defense counsel requests additional time with interpreter.  Court will grant approval for an additional 15 hours of interpreter time.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ngin Tual Pum in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Ngin Tual Pum.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko by zoom. (Burmese)
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Court will allow 5 hours of interpreter time for defense counsel, defendant, and interpreter to meet.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ngin Tual Pum in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko. Case in court for pretrial conference. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as Burmese interpreter: Koko, Simon

Court ordered no contact with CZM (11/1/65) 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ngin Tual Pum in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Ngin Tual Pum in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ngin Tual Pum appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
